column1: Rule 1: Modifiers containing both amino and carboxylic acid groups, especially when they are part of a short aliphatic chain (3-5 carbons) and the amino group is at the α or β position relative to the carboxylic acid, tend to result in high yield.
column2: Rule 2: Modifiers with a benzene ring substituted with electron-withdrawing groups such as nitro or bromomethyl tend to result in high yield.
column3: Rule 4: Modifiers with a pyridine ring, especially when not substituted with additional electron-withdrawing groups, tend to result in high yield.
